abstract: Lily Safra, the widow of the financier and philanthropist Edmond J. Safra, has donated $12.3 million to Harvard University to pay for a research laboratory focusing on institutional corruption.
snippet: Lily Safra, the widow of the financier and philanthropist Edmond J. Safra, has donated $12.3 million to Harvard University to pay for a research laboratory focusing on institutional corruption.
lead_paragraph: In this age of great corporate scandals, business schools have understandably ratcheted up their focus on corporate ethics in recent years.  But what about when people generally follow the rules — and bad things still happen?

headline.main: With Gift, Harvard to Study Institutional Corruption

abstract: Without the one-time writedown, the bank said it earned $3.1 billion, or 27 cents a share, which topped forecasts.
snippet: Without the one-time writedown, the bank said it earned $3.1 billion, or 27 cents a share, which topped forecasts.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America, the nation’s biggest bank, announced Tuesday that operating profit rebounded in the third quarter, helped by improved credit conditions among consumers and businesses.

headline.main: Bank of America Reports $7.3 Billion Loss, Citing Charges
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Reports $7.3 Billion Loss, Citing Card Charges

abstract: Bank of America said on Tuesday that it lost $7.3 billion for the third quarter, after taking a previously announced $10.4 billion loss tied to its credit cards business.
snippet: Bank of America said on Tuesday that it lost $7.3 billion for the third quarter, after taking a previously announced $10.4 billion loss tied to its credit cards business.
lead_paragraph: 7:35 a.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz has more on Bank of America’s third-quarter earnings.

headline.main: BofA Posts $7.3 Billion Loss on One-Time Charge

abstract: Despite Bank of America’s announcement that it will resume foreclosures, state law-enforcement officials and the White House say they will continue their inquiries.
snippet: Despite Bank of America’s announcement that it will resume foreclosures, state law-enforcement officials and the White House say they will continue their inquiries.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America may be trying to bring down the curtain on the foreclosure furor, but there were numerous indications Tuesday that the problems would not move off-stage so quickly.

headline.main: Intermission, at Best, in Battle Over Foreclosures
headline.print_headline: Intermission, at Best, in Battle Over Foreclosures

abstract: The New York Fed and other bondholders argued in a letter that Countrywide failed to properly service the loans.
snippet: The New York Fed and other bondholders argued in a letter that Countrywide failed to properly service the loans.
lead_paragraph: A group of financial institutions demanding that Bank of America repurchase $47 billion worth of loans packaged by Countrywide Financial has an unusual new member: the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

headline.main: New York Fed Urges BofA to Buy Back Loans
